page.title: 02 NORTON CONYERS
page.content: {Norton Conyers}is a mediaeval house situated about one kilometre south of Wath. It was built of red brick about 1500 and the Dutch gable ends were added in 1630. It is set in attractive, but not formal gardens and both house and gardens are open to the public. The remainder of the 1500 acre estate is farmed. The Graham family have owned{Norton {Conyers}since 1624 and although Sir James Graham has recently died his mother still resides there. There are two items of particular interest in the house. One is a fine, large table inlaid with marble that dates from 1570. The other is a letter from{Charles 2nd}asking for a loan of money.
